data.description:
22 May 1968. The American submarine USS Scorpion (SSN-589) has dissapeared in the Atlantic for mysterious reasons.

23 May 1968. As a Soviet deep diver, your mission is to find the Scorpion before the Americans and extract the valuable cargo it contains: an early prototype of the MK48 nuclear torpedo. The depths are dangerous and the exact location of the submarine unknown. Use your ingenuity and stealth to sneak past sharks and explore the ocean floor before running out of air...

Apnea detects your breath and steps in the real world to transport you to the depths of the ocean in a VR game like you have never experienced before: Walk on your tip-toes to avoid making any noise or run for your life to hide from the monsters of the sea, but be careful with your exhalations or you will drown before accomplishing the mission.

changelog.change_log:
- improved gameplay. Geiger counter now guides the user toward local objectives and hiding zones work better and are highlighted.
- small bugfixes and gameplay tweaks

- Fixed stuck situation
- Remembering last level played
- Better Controller support

- reduced difficulty
- reduced shark senses range (you can walk closer to the shark, and it wont see you from so far away)
- reduced oxygen consumption

- updated engine and Oculus versions
- improved performance
- improved GearVR controller support
- dynamic difficulty
- unlocked levels

- improved shark attack distance
- vegetation moves away from the player to avoid eye strain
- improved divers arm model
- touchpad/controller movement supported, user can disable step detection if desired
- reticle colliding with all objects now
- improved texture compression

- added GearVR controller support. USe it to look at your watch and geiger counter in game, increasing presence.
 - updated to unity 5.6
 - improved walking detection (less false positives)
 - polished light
 - new instructions scene
- fixed fade to black system
- Improved droplets in helmet. Now they just appear when you are in the last 8% of Oxygen and are smaller.

- Improved breathing performance impact
- Fixed translations

- Improved instructions sequence: gaze input, menus and better gamepad explanations
- More robust breathing detection
- Automatic breathing mode, for extreme conditions such as no microphone under the nose or noisy enviornment
- Drop convergence fixed
- Improved overall performance
- Updated to latest SDK
- Improved lightning in boat scene to reduce ghosting
- Improved text readability in boat scene
- Sightly easier difficulty
- Generalised code for Daydream support
- Tested with over 150 people at Manchester Science Week festival

- Fixed gamepad death zones bug causing unperceptible movement
- More robust breath detection under noisy conditions
- Smaller range for bubbles noise

- Improved performance in Note 4 Lollipop
- Exposed gamepad controls for walking

- Fixed credits
- Air increased 
- Removed god mode
